intro: Scuticaria hadwenii var. dodgsonii, commonly known as the Dodgson's scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to dry, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
